alert.note: Alert for Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 1:36PM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Aiken, Bamberg, Barnwell, Calhoun, Edgefield, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lexington, Newberry, Orangeburg, Richland and Saluda. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Aiken, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Newberry, Batesburg-Leesville, Barnwell, Winnsboro, Denmark, Springdale, Red Bank, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Oak Grove, St. Andrews, VC Summer Nuclear Station and Dentsville. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 26 between mile markers 67 and 134. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 15 and 82. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 50. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov. Minor flooding will occur in the Five Points area extending downstream along Rocky Branch Creek. This includes Maxcy Gregg Park, areas of the USC campus along the creek, the intersection at Pickens and Blossom, the intersection at Whaley and Main and areas of the Olympia neighborhood along the creek.
